ECEL 301.courseDesc: Offers laboratory experiences in each of the five ECE tracks: computers, controls/robotics, electronics, power and energy, and telecommunications. Each lab consists of a stand-alone module containing: lecture material providing basic theory, references, and laboratory experiments.
ECEL 301.prereqs: ECE 200 [Min Grade D] and ECE 201 [Min Grade D]

ECEL 302.courseDesc: Offers laboratory experiences in each of the five ECE tracks: computers, controls/robotics, electronics, power and energy, and telecommunications. Each lab consists of a stand-alone module containing: lecture material providing basic theory, references, and laboratory experiments. Some or all pre-requisites may be taken as either a pre-requisite or co-requisite. Please see the department for more information.

ECEL 303.courseDesc: Offers laboratory experiences in each of the five ECE tracks: computers, controls/robotics, electronics, power and energy, and telecommunications. Each lab consists of a stand-alone module containing: lecture material providing basic theory, references, and laboratory experiments.

ECEL 304.courseDesc: This course offers laboratory experience, using both modeling software and digital and analog hardware relevant to both electrical and computer engineers. Multi-week design projects and design teams are used to prepare students for Senior Design work.

ECEL 311.courseDesc: Introduces students to MATLAB and PSpice, industry standard CAD software for electronics (analog and digital) and systems engineers. Solve DC bias, DC sweep, AC sweep, and transient problems in PSpice and MATLAB. Build and design simple digital circuits.
ECEL 311.prereqs: ECE 200 [Min Grade D] and ECE 201 [Min Grade D]

ECEL 312.courseDesc: Covers introduction to transistor circuits, PSpice simulations of active devices, transfer function analysis, Bode analysis, active filter analysis and design. Programming and use of Microprocessors and/or FPGA. Perform measurements on devices and circuits.
ECEL 312.prereqs: ECEL 301 [Min Grade D] or ECEL 311 [Min Grade D]

ECEL 401.courseDesc: Teaches fundamentals of interaction of light with matter. Waves and photons. nterference and diffraction. Optical fibers and free-space optics. Introduces students to optical communication and imaging.
ECEL 401.prereqs: (ECEL 301 [Min Grade D] and ECEL 302 [Min Grade D] and ECE 370 [Min Grade D]) or (ECEL 311 [Min Grade D] and ECEL 312 [Min Grade D] and ECEE 304 [Min Grade D])

ECEL 402.courseDesc: Teaches a fundamental knowledge of nanophotonic materials, devices, and applications in a hands-on laboratory setting. Introduces students to photonic bandgaps, photonic crystals, optical sensing methods, holography methods and materials, concepts of surface plasmons and Plasmon resonance.
ECEL 402.prereqs: (ECEL 301 [Min Grade D] and ECEL 302 [Min Grade D] and ECEE 304 [Min Grade D]) or (ECEL 311 [Min Grade D] and ECEL 312 [Min Grade D] and ECEE 304 [Min Grade D])

ECEL 403.courseDesc: Teaches the fundamentals of the interaction of light with matter. Introduces students to different types of optical detection for biomedical applications,Quantized states of matter, Energy levels of atoms and molecules, Absorption, Scattering, Fluorescence, Imaging of cells and molecules, Spectroscopy, and Cancer precursors.
ECEL 403.prereqs: (ECEL 301 [Min Grade D] and ECEL 302 [Min Grade D] and ECEE 304 [Min Grade D]) or (ECEL 311 [Min Grade D] or ECEL 312 [Min Grade D] or ECEE 304 [Min Grade D])

ECEL 404.courseDesc: This course introduces students to the concept of software defined radio using the USRP hardware platform and GNU Radio software. Functional blocks of wireless communications systems will be discussed, programmed in Python, and tested on hardware.
ECEL 404.prereqs: (ECEL 301 [Min Grade D] and ECEL 302 [Min Grade D] and ECES 301 [Min Grade D] and ECES 303 [Min Grade D]) or (ECEL 311 [Min Grade D] and ECEL 312 [Min Grade D] and ECES 301 [Min Grade D] and ECES 303 [Min Grade D])

ECEL 405.courseDesc: Students will gain practical knowledge of digital systems and signal processing by designing, simulating, constructing, testing and refining a digital audio recording system.
ECEL 405.prereqs: (ECEL 301 [Min Grade D] and ECEL 302 [Min Grade D] and ECES 301 [Min Grade D]) or (ECEL 311 [Min Grade D] and ECEL 312 [Min Grade D] and ECES 301 [Min Grade D])
